snippet: The amount of the gas in the air has not been this high for at least three million years, and scientists believe the rise portends large changes in the climate and sea level.
abstract: Scientific instruments show level of the most important heat-trapping gas in the atmosphere, carbon dioxide, has passed a long-feared milestone, reaching concentration not seen on the earth for millions of years; China is now the largest emitter, but Americans have been consuming fossil fuels extensively for far longer, and experts say the United States is more responsible than any other nation for the high level.
lead_paragraph: The amount of the gas in the air has not been this high for at least three million years, and scientists believe the rise portends large changes in the climate and sea level.

headline.print_headline: Heat-Trapping Gas Passes Milestone, Raising Fears
headline.seo: Carbon Dioxide Level Passes Long-Feared Milestone
headline.main: Heat-Trapping Gas Passes Milestone, Raising Fears
